name: putMenuForIngestion
description: This will begin an asynchronous process that will lead to that menu becoming live on the Just Eat platform

tenant.description: The tenant of the restaurant in which to put a menu

restaurantId.description: The restaurant identifier to associated with the menu

Authorization.description: Containing a partner issued API key e.g. `JE-API-KEY ABCDE123456789`

Content-Type.description: Used to denote the version of the menu payload within the body, will default to latest if not supplied e.g. application/=1.0

body.description: Specification of the menu. This must be valid according to the rules described here: https://developers.just-eat.com/docs/pos-how-the-integration-works#validation-rules

$ul: **correlationId**: An ID for the asynchronous operation to ingest the menu
**faultId**: A value that helps identify this response back to logs, so we can easily find this specific fault
**traceId**: A value that helps identify the trace back to logs, so that we can easily find what was happening on our system when the fault was generated
